comments.body: why is the cadvisor changes in the logging soak?
so i can add more `readConfig` impls.  otherwise its global and interferes w/ others.
ug, we need to split up the e2es into libraries.
This is fine for now, but it's worth thinking about how we could parameterize the version, and delegate path construction to the client library (pkg/client).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +59,63 @@			// cadvisor is not accessible directly unless its port (4194 by default) is exposed.
			// Here, we access '/stats/' REST endpoint on the kubelet which polls cadvisor internally.
			statsResource := fmt.Sprintf("api/v1/proxy/nodes/%s/stats/", node.Name)
			By(fmt.Sprintf("Querying stats from node %s using url %s", node.Name, statsResource))
			_, err = c.Get().AbsPath(statsResource).Timeout(timeout).Do().Raw()

comments.body: Am I reading this right? Each timeout is a minute, across 2 nodes, for 10 retries, so you want a budget of 20 minutes for this test to fail?
Yes. That is the intent. At this point, I don't even know the reason for the failure. We can dial this back once the test passes successfully.

comments.body: Use `Logf` here (added in a similar timeframe)
Actually, you're right, this is more By() like. (Splitting hairs.)
